general_advisory: Due to low temperature, apply thin layer of dry FYM on nursery to maintain the temperature. Start sowing the summer crops when the temperature is conducive for germination.

advisory: Sow Mung varieties IPM -02-14, IPM -02-3, PDM -11, PDM -54, Durga, Samrat, K -851, Sarla, PU -31, PU -30, PU -35, PU -19 etc. at a rate of 25 kg of seeds per hectare.
Transplant seedlings in 20cm X 10 cm spacing when they are 3 weeks old.
Top dress with 16 kg Nitrogen per acre at 3 weeks of growth.
Transplant 10-12 days old seedlings on the main field.
Transplant seedlings in 20cm X 10 cm spacing when they are 3 weeks old. Apply 24:12:12 kg NPK per acre.
Go for intercultivation and earthing up work and apply 8 kg Nitrogen per acre at 2-3 weeks old.
Apply gypsum in lines @ 50kg/acre if not done at sowing.
Irrigate at crown root initiation and jointing stage, apply 8 kg Nitrogen per acre for early sown crop.
Apply 6-8 kg nitrogen per acre at 25-30 days after sowing. Choose good varieties like MSFH 17, KBSH1, Jwalamukhi.
Apply remaining fertilizer of Nitrogen 30 kg/acre in delayed sown crop. Manage Leaf blight with Mancozeb.
Manage Brinjal Foot & Shoot borer with Neem based pesticides.
Spray leaves with 2 ml of abamectin 9.1% or ethion per liter of water if leaf spot appears in pepper crop.
Keep animal shed clean and dry. Provide vaccination and proper nutrition.
Add furasil to water for 3 days. Administer Lasota vaccine within the first 7 days to control chicken rabies.
